message_1:
Suppose two friends, Alice and Bob, plan to meet up for a night out. If they both show up at the same location, they can either go to a basketball game (B) or a ballet (L). They each have their preferences but want to be together. Alice prefers ballet over basketball and Bob prefers basketball over ballet. However, if they both show up at different locations, they would both go home alone (0).

1. Construct the payoff matrix for the Battle of the Sexes game
   | B   L
---|-------
 B | 2,1  0,0
 L | 0,0  1,2

2. Assuming Alice and Bob make their decision at the same time without communicating, what is the Nash equilibrium of the game?
   The Nash equilibrium is (B, L), where Bob goes to the basketball game and Alice goes to the ballet.

3. What is the maximum possible sum of the payoffs and what strategy pair achieves this?
   The maximum possible sum of payoffs in this game is 3, which can be achieved by the strategy pair (B, L) or (L, B).
